summary:
Headline:  
Adobe delivered a solid Q2 with 9% revenue growth driven by strong subscription performance, particularly in Digital Media ARR. Margins improved, and the company reaffirmed full-year guidance with a slight upward revision to operating margin expectations.

Growth & revenue drivers:  
- Total revenue grew 9% year-over-year.  
- Digital Media Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) grew in the double digits.  
- Subscription revenue remains the primary growth engine, led by Creative Cloud and Document Cloud segments.

Margins / profitability:  
- Gross margin improved by 80 basis points, attributed to pricing optimization and enhanced cloud efficiency.  
- Operating margin guidance was raised slightly compared to prior outlook.

Guidance & outlook:  
- Full-year guidance was reaffirmed.  
- Operating margin is now expected to improve slightly beyond previous expectations.

Risks / watchpoints:  
- No specific risks or headwinds were mentioned in the remarks.  
- Monitor execution on pricing and cloud efficiency initiatives to sustain margin improvements.
